title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 February 2015 - XWiki
content:
<fmancinelli> has quit  
00:43 <debajit\_> What test frameworks does XWiki use?  
00:44 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
00:49 <vrachieru> has quit

05:39 <spawn57\_> has joined #xwiki  
05:40 <spawn57\_> hi, I want to change the look of Title 1 to Title 6 in XWiki.  They look too similair. Is there anyway to change it?  
06:11 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki

09:53 <spawn57\_> I want to change the look of Title 1 to Title 6 in the WYSWYG editor.  They look too similair. Is there anyway to change it?  
09:54 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <vrachieru> has quit  
09:57 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <tmortagne> hmm something changed in the packager maven plugin, what causes http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-filter-test-tests/945/testReport/org.xwiki.filter.test.ui/FilterTest/testConvertXMLURL/ is that XWiki does not ends up with the right jars  
10:11 <gdelhumeau> I have changed the order of the installation of the dependencies some weeks ago  
10:12 <tmortagne> only for the XAR no ?  
10:13 <tmortagne> as far as I can see the issue here is that the packaged XWiki has the <scope>test</scope> jars but not the others  
10:14 <tmortagne> while it used to be the opposite  
10:15 <gdelhumeau> indeed  
10:15 <tmortagne> but packagemojo seems to heva the right @requiresDependencyResolution  
10:15 <gdelhumeau> only the xars  
10:15 <tmortagne> (runtime)  
10:30 <tmortagne> hmm its more complex than that actually  
10:32 <tmortagne> it's not copying test dependencies, it just happen that those tests dependencies are mandatory dependencies  
10:35 <gdelhumeau> My firefox has ben updated this morning, and now I cannot run integration tests  
10:36 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: strange I've upgraded to the latest seleniulm  
10:36 <gdelhumeau> on 6.4.x?  
10:36 <vmassol> no  
10:36 <vmassol> master only  
10:36 <vmassol> on master we now support: "\* Updating Native events to support Firefox 24, 31, 32 and 33"  
10:37 <vmassol> (thanks to 2.44.0-  
10:37 <vmassol> )  
10:37 <vmassol> (see https://code.google.com/p/selenium/source/browse/java/CHANGELOG )  
10:37 <vmassol> you can still reinstall an old FF  
10:37 <vmassol> I have several versions locally for example  
10:37 <vmassol> (for this use case :))  
10:37 <gdelhumeau> I had an old firefox by the past  
10:37 <gdelhumeau> but not for a few months, it was not needed  
10:38 <vmassol> alternatively you could upgrade to latest selenium on the 6.4.x branch but you need to verify that all tests continue to work (they should)  
10:38 <gdelhumeau> I can't  
10:38 <vmassol> (they should since I didn't notice any problem on mster when I upgraded)  
10:38 <gdelhumeau> it's for a distribution based on 6.4.2  
10:38 <vmassol> ok  
10:38 <vmassol> then you need an older FF  
10:38 <gdelhumeau> indeed  
10:40 <vmassol> going to commit an upgrade to DBCP 2.1.. potentially risky but now is the right time since 7.0 is the beginning of the cycle  
10:40 <vmassol> (rebuilding all platform ATM)  
10:43 <cjd> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/displayer-multiselect-suggest  <-- does anyone know if this has a bugtracker?  
10:44 <tmortagne> I don't think so, looks like github bugtracker was disabled by reflex by whoever created the repo  
10:45 <vmassol> I always disable the github tracker since we use jira  
10:45 <vmassol> same for the wiki, we use xwiki  
10:45 <tmortagne> we use jira but some contrib projects don't have corresponding jira  
10:45 <vmassol> then we create them when they need them  
10:45 <tmortagne> should be disbaled only when we creat a jira project for it  
10:46 <vmassol> no  
10:46 <vmassol> not unless we decide it together  
10:46 <vmassol> right now  
10:46 <vmassol> we have only 1 tool  
10:46 <vmassol> it's jira  
10:46 <vmassol> and it's documented on contrib.xwiki.org  
10:46 <woshilapin> has quit  
10:48 <vmassol> we started a thread on this but we didn't conclude AFAIR so right now the status quo is still jira for contrib projects  
10:48 <vmassol> we can revive this thread  
10:48 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:49 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:00 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:24 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <gdelhumeau> Enygma`, vmassol: BFD today?  
11:25 <Enygma`> yes, announcing it now  
11:25 <Enygma`> almost forgot about it  
11:26 <vrachieru> has quit  
11:30 <Enygma`> done  
11:32 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
11:38 <vmassol> Enygma`: hi  
11:38 <vmassol> there's a small problem I think with your migration  
11:38 <vmassol> it executes on a clean XE while it shouldn't  
11:39 <vmassol> I've just rebuilt XE from sources and I got it. Do you think you could check that out?  
11:39 <vmassol> my guess is simply that you forgot a de  
11:39 <vmassol> the data module needs to know about it to run it during import  
11:47 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:52 <Enygma`> hm, did not know about it  
11:52 <Enygma`> adding  
11:58 <Enygma`> vmassol: please let me know if that fixed it  
11:58 <Enygma`> when you next download a snapshot  
11:59 <vmassol> it should  
12:02 <Enygma`> tmortagne: is this issue still valid? http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-1543  
12:03 <tmortagne> Enygma`: yes  
12:04 <Enygma`> I know I`ve seen issues in the past, but now I don`t anymore  
12:04 <Enygma`> is it because we apply xar:format?  
12:04 <tmortagne> well  
12:04 <tmortagne> the issue is kind of still valid  
12:05 <tmortagne> what happen ow is that you still have the \r but encoded because that's how stax serializer treat it so from pureely textual point of view it's not really inconsistent anymore  
12:05 <tmortagne> s/ow/now/  
12:05 <tmortagne> but then we apply xar:format which uses an old SAX serializer  
12:06 <tmortagne> but we should not have the \r in the exported result IMO encoded or not  
12:06 <tmortagne> at least not for content coming from wiki editor  
12:06 <Enygma`> ok, so that means I can not close the issuse :)  
12:06 <Enygma`> thanks for the info  
12:07 <tmortagne> yes I don't think we can close the issue which is the reason for my first answer

17:01 <OSIMasson> has quit  
17:10 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
17:11 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
17:13 <Slashman> hello, any idea why xwiki update from 6.4.1 to 6.4.2 on debian system now depends on "default-jre", which depends on "openjdk-6-jre"...  
17:13 <vmassol> Slashman: no idea but tmortagne might know  
17:13 <Slashman> it resets the default jdk to openjdk6, great...  
17:16 <tmortagne> Slashman: XWiki does not require openjdk and expcially not the 6  
17:16 <tmortagne> the exact dependencies declared by XWiki package are "java7-runtime-headless | java7-runtime" so whatever have one of these  
17:16 <tmortagne> I did an upgrade from 6.4.1 to 6.4.2 on ubuntu server 14.10 myself and did not have any change on java side  
17:17 <Slashman> well, I have the same issue on 3 xwiki here, there is nothing else on the servers, they are simple vm  
17:18 <tmortagne> Slashman: maybe there is an issue with default-jre package that does not have much to do with XWiki, just happen that it changes at the same time  
17:19 <Slashman> tmortagne: I didn't have it previously  
17:19 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
17:19 <tmortagne> Slashman: you can check yourself the dependencies XWiki package declare, as I you can see in what I copy pasted it has nothing to do with default-jre and it clearly require a version 7  
17:20 <Slashman> tmortagne: http://apaste.info/Buv  
17:20 <tmortagne> are you doing apt-get upgrade to are you installing apt-get install of new xwiki version ?  
17:22 <Slashman> tmortagne: http://apaste.info/tTb :/  
17:22 <Slashman> xwiki-enterprise-tomcat7-pgsql Depends: default-jre | java6-runtime  
17:22 <tmortagne> I don't have the issue with mysql, let me check the dependency tree of xwiki-enterprise-tomcat7-pgsql  
17:26 <tmortagne> crap it's possible it's because of https://github.com/tcurdt/jdeb/pull/126  
17:26 <tmortagne> the depends are not there in XWiki control file but I think it's injected at build time  
17:27 <tmortagne> checking that  
17:27 <tmortagne> I wonder why I don't have the issue with mysql package  
17:27 <tmortagne> now I did not upgraded jdeb between 6.4.1 and 6.4.2 so I don't see why this would be new  
17:29 <Slashman> should I raise a ticket?  
17:29 <tmortagne> sure  
17:29 <tmortagne> debugging it  
17:34 <tmortagne> Slashman: found and fixed the cause, I will deploy new builds  
17:36 <Slashman> tmortagne: great, I'm still writting the ticket  
17:37 <Slashman> tmortagne: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1471  
17:37 <tmortagne> thanks  
17:37 <Slashman> tmortagne: no, thank you :)  
17:37 <OSIMasson> has quit  
17:37 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
17:54 <OSIMasson> has quit  
17:58 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
18:03 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:06 <OSIMasson> has quit  
18:15 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
18:19 <Slashman> tmortagne: it seems I'm stuck in a loop in the upgrade wizard between 6.4.1 and 6.4.2  
18:26 <Slashman> tmortagne: at the end of the wizard to update to 6.4.2, after the installation of the wiki page version 6.4.2, it asks for "uninstall", which uninstall 6.4.2 pages and then you have to "install" again, I had to postpone at "uninstall" to exit the loop  
18:31 <OSIMasson> has quit  
18:32 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
18:36 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:37 <lucaa> has quit  
18:40 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
18:43 <tmortagne> Slashman: after the install you should have a continue button enabled in the bottom of the page, it does not ask you to uninstall you just have a uninstall button because that's how the extension view works (since the extension is installed you can uninstall it)  
18:44 <Slashman> tmortagne: created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1472 , it is different from all my previous updates fo xwiki  
18:44 <Slashman> tmortagne: no "continue" button this time  
18:45 <Slashman> tmortagne: I was in a loop between those 2 wizard screen  
18:47 <tmortagne> Slashman: did you try to refresh ? I remember some issue about a race condition in the javascript code changing the button on the bottom mflorea never was able to reproduce enough to fix it  
18:47 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:47 <Slashman> tmortagne: I didn't try it, sorry :(  
18:48 <mflorea> try refresh with force clear cache  
18:48 <Slashman> tmortagne: but I installed/uninstalled something like 3 times  
18:48 <Slashman> mflorea: well, I postponed the wizard at the end, I don't know how to have the wizard again

23:35 <vmassol> and one more automation achievement done : http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/AutomationAchievements :)  
23:37 <evalica> :)  
23:38 <evalica> that's nice - it's going to be useful  
23:38 <vmassol> hope so!  
23:38 <vmassol> doing my share to continue using jira because I prefere a unified issue tracker than lots of small islands ;)  
23:39 <vmassol> (for various reasons: BFD, stats, consistency, features, etc)  
23:39 <evalica> yes - I like jira too
